intro: Brachystelma togoense, commonly known as the Togo stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, often blooming in spring. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
